The Union of Needle trades, Industrial, and Textile Employees  was a labor union in the United States, formed in 1995 as a merger between the International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union  and the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union . In 2004, UNITE announced that it would merge with the Hotel Employees and Restaurant Employees Union  to form UNITE HERE. In 2009 most of the apparel and laundry workers in UNITE HERE broke away to form a separate union known as Workers United, which affiliated with the Service Employees International Union.
UNITE's core industries were textile and apparel manufacturing, distribution, and retailing, but they also had locals involved in industrial laundry, and manufacturing in other industries.
Jay Mazur served as president of UNITE from its inception until his retirement in 2001. Bruce Raynor was then elected president, where he served until the HERE merger.
title: Unite
